alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Mason (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:37PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Gallia, east central Lawrence, southern Mason, Cabell, western Kanawha and Putnam Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ona, or 7 miles east of Proctorville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nitro, Winfield, St. Albans, Hurricane, Barboursville, Milton, Eleanor, Buffalo, Ona, Culloden, Teays Valley, Tornado, Bancroft, Crown City, Athalia, Ashton, Grimms Landing, Pea Ridge, Green Bottom and Fraziers Bottom. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 16 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
